references: T. M. Apostol, Introduction to Analytic Number Theory, Springer-Verlag, 1976, page 48, problem 15, the function phi_4(n).
L. E. Dickson, History of the Theory of Numbers, Vol. I (Reprint 1966), p. 140.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
P. G. Brown, Some comments on inverse arithmetic functions, Math. Gaz. 89 (2005) 403-408.
formula: a(n)=(6*n^4*A000010(n)+10*n^3*A023900(n)-n*A063453(n))/30 for n>1. Formula is derived from a more general formula of A. Thacker (1850), see [Dickson, Brown]. - _Franz Vrabec_, Aug 21 2005
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[If[GCD[n, k] == 1, k^4, 0], {k, 1, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 31}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Feb 26 2014 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 07 2000
